channel.title: [718]Saving new things to the character file?
channel.description:
I want to save new things to the character file. Lets say, for example, I want to make PK points. How would I make them save in the character's file?\
Thanks in advice, Arham

item.title: [718]Saving new things to the character file?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Arcik:

Just declare them in Player.java and it’ll save. Didn’t you look through how save works?

Just a simple declaration? O.O

Strucker:

if you switch to this revision ill fudge you srsly. :palm:

Naw man. I’m playing around with this base heh.

EDIT: Holy! That is amazing! Just declaring a variable gets it written!

Read full topic

item.title: [718]Saving new things to the character file?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Strucker:

if you switch to this revision ill fudge you srsly. :palm:

Me or arham?

and @Arham look in the file PkRank.java. Looks like the creator of this source made separate files to do the saving.

EX: In the code :
public PkRank(Player player) {
this.username = player.getUsername();
this.kills = player.getKillCount();
this.deaths = player.getDeathCount();
}

AND IN PasswordEncryptor.java :

public static void encrypt() {
	File[] chars = new File("./checkacc/").listFiles();
	for (File acc : chars) {
		try {
			Player player = (Player) SerializableFilesManager.loadSerializedFile(acc);
			if(player == null || player.getPassword() == null)
				continue;
			System.out.println(player.getPassword());
			player.setPassword(Encrypt.encryptSHA1(player.getPassword()));
			System.out.println(player.getPassword());
			SerializableFilesManager.storeSerializableClass(player, acc);
		} catch (Throwable e) {
			System.out.println("failed: " + acc.getName()+", "+e);
		}
	}
}

Read full topic

item.title: [718]Saving new things to the character file?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:8, topic:528907”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=647662.msg4355932#msg4355932 date=1377570427]

Ohhh well then there has to be a location where it saves the player file. It can’t be too hard to find either. Normally it would be in the utils folder.

and btw: I’m attempting to add canoes to my 2006 Remake. Now the problem im having right now is that I can’t seem to replace an object with another.

I’ve been looking everywhere. Been looking at the common stuff like how it grabs the run energy from the character’s file. Nothing. All I see is them being called, never set.

And at your question: remove it and then add it instead of replacing.
[/quote]

You’ve checked Player.java? All the getter and setter methods are usually located within that file.[/quote]
I used an IDE to find all usages. It showed ever call to that Integer. Its never set, its just called all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: [718]Saving new things to the character file?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:2, topic:528907”]You can make amazing servers but you can’t figure this out? Not saying it in a harsh way by the way but yeah. Go to like PlayerSave.java and find where it says all the write to file and read from file stuff.

This is how it is on my 377 server btw :

		write.writeInt(player.getCurrentQuestPoints());

then like 30-50 lines beneath that,

        player.setCurrentQuestPoints(load.readInt());

I think that order matters because once I placed a new variable in between two existing ones and my server got loved up.

Try adding the Pk Point variable at the bottom of the list :D[/quote]
I swear to you man. Matrix over-complicated its design.

EDIT: You do realize that PlayerSave is not a class in 718 right?

Read full topic
item.source: [718]Saving new things to the character file?

item.title: [718]Saving new things to the character file?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

You can make amazing servers but you can’t figure this out? Not saying it in a harsh way by the way but yeah. Go to like PlayerSave.java and find where it says all the write to file and read from file stuff.

This is how it is on my 377 server btw :

		write.writeInt(player.getCurrentQuestPoints());

then like 30-50 lines beneath that,

        player.setCurrentQuestPoints(load.readInt());

I think that order matters because once I placed a new variable in between two existing ones and my server got loved up.

Try adding the Pk Point variable at the bottom of the list

Read full topic
